item.title: Adding meson syntax highlighting
item.description:
Introduction

This is a small post/tutorial/diary about how i added meson syntax to my website.

It is no surprise i use Zola to generate my website and besides a few hiccups it all works very well. One of those hiccups is that i like meson but Zola doesn't meet me halfway with meson highlighting.

item.title: Updating packages with tmplgen
item.description:
Introduction

This is a follow up tutorial on my first tutorial, Reading that is highly recommended and it is assumed you already know the basics covered in that.

Today i saw a package needed updating, ruby-faraday_middleware. A great opportunity to write this article in how tmplgen can help you keep your language specific packages updated.

./xbps-src update-check srcpkgs/ruby-faraday_middleware
ruby-faraday_middleware-0.13.0 -> ruby-faraday_middleware-0.13.1

item.title: Basic usage of tmplgen, a Void Linux template generator
item.description:
Introduction

Many modern languages (and some old ones) today have their own package manager ecosystem, where someone working on that language can easily get pieces of code written by other people that do their task for them.

A few examples include:

  • meta::cpan for Perl.
  • PyPi for Python.
  • RubyGems for Ruby.
  • crates for Rust.

item.title: How this site is done
item.description:
Introduction

This small post will show all about how this site, which is hosted via GitHub Pages, and is for all intents and purposes a blog, is done.

Hopefully this post can also be of help to users that want a similar setup.

Without further ado.
